Questions.question: Choose the correct option in terms of Issues related to professional responsibility
“Software engineers should not use their technical skills to misuse other people’s computers.”Here the term misuse refers to:
Questions.option4: Dissemination of viruses or other malware

Questions.question: What is a Software ?
Questions.option2: Software is documentation and configuration of data
Questions.option3: Software is set of programs, documentation & configuration of data

Questions.question: The product should be easy to use
Questions.option1: The product should be easy to use
Questions.option2: Software engineers shall ensure that their products and related modifications meet the highest professional standards possible
Questions.option3: Software engineers shall ensure that their products and related modifications satisfy the client
Questions.option4: It means that the product designed /created should be easily available

Questions.question: Which of these is not true ?
Questions.option1: Web has led to availability of software services and possibility of developing highly distributed service based systems
Questions.option2: Web based systems have led to degradation of programming languages
Questions.option3: Web brings concept of software as service

Questions.option1: Your employer releases a safety-critical system without finishing the testing of the system
Questions.option3: Agreement in principle with the policies of senior management

Questions.question: Identify the correct statement: “Software engineers shall
Questions.option1: act in a manner that is in the best interests of his expertise and favour.”
Questions.option2: act consistently with the public interest.”
Questions.option3: ensure that their products only meet the SRS.”

Questions.question: Select the incorrect statement: “Software engineers should
Questions.option1: not knowingly accept work that is outside your competence.”
Questions.option2: not use your technical skills to misuse other people’s computers.”
Questions.option4: maintain integrity and independence in their professional judgment.”

The reason for software bugs and failures is due to
Which of the following statements explains portability in non-functional requirements?
Questions.option1: It is a degree to which software running on one platform can easily be converted to run on another platform
Questions.option2: It cannot be enhanced by using languages, OS’ and tools that are universally available and standardized
Questions.option3: The ability of the system to behave consistently in a user-acceptable manner when operating within the environment for which the system was intended

Questions.question: Choose the incorrect statement with respect to Non-Functional Requirement(NFR).
Questions.option1: Product-oriented Approach – Focus on system (or software) quality
Questions.option2: Process-oriented Approach – Focus on how NFRs can be used in the design process
Questions.option3: Quantitative Approach – Find measurable scales for the functionality attributes
Questions.option4: Qualitative Approach – Study various relationships between quality goals

Questions.question: Which of the following property does not correspond to a good Software Requirements Specification (SRS) ?
The SRS is said to be consistent if and only if
Questions.option1: its structure and style are such that any changes to the requirements can be made easily while retaining the style and structure
Questions.option2: every requirement stated therein is one that the software shall meet
Questions.option3: every requirement stated therein is verifiable
Questions.option4: no subset of individual requirements described in it conflict with each other

Questions.question:
Which of the following statements about SRS is/are true ?
i. SRS is written by customer
ii. SRS is written by a developer
iii. SRS serves as a contract between customer and developer
Questions.option2: Both ii and iii are true

Questions.question:
Starting from least to most important, choose the order of stakeholder.
i. Managers
ii. Entry level Personnel
iii. Users
iv. Middle level stakeholder

i. General description
ii. Introduction
iii. Index
iv. Appendices
v. Specific Requirements
Consider the following Statement: “The output of a program shall be given within 10 secs of event X 10% of the time.”What characteristic of SRS is being depicted here ?

Considering the example of issue/return of a book, cataloging etc. in a library management.What type of management requirement is being depicted here?

As per an IBM report, “31%of the project get cancelled before they are completed, 53% overrun their cost estimates by an average of 189% and for every 100 projects, there are 94 restarts”.What is the reason for these statistics
Questions.option1: Lack of adequate training in software engineering
Questions.option2: Lack of software ethics and understanding

Questions.question: Quality costs may be divided into costs associated with

Poka-yoke devices are mechanisms that lead to the
A. creation of quality processes with minimal resources
B. determining causes of software defects
C. prevention of potential quality problems
D. rapid detection of quality problems introduced

Questions.option1: Adds value for developers and users
Questions.option3: Removes need to consider performance issues

Questions.question:
Which of the following are ISO 9126 software quality factors?
A. Functionality
B. Portability
C. Reliability
D. Visual appeal
. Which of the following is likely to be the most expensive cost of quality?
Which of the following management decisions have the potential to impact software quality?

The level of review formality is determined by which of the following?
A. amount of preparation
B. reviewer follow-up
C. size of project budget
D. structure of review

An informal review may consist of which of the following?
A. casual meeting
B. desk check
C. inspection
D. pair programming
Which of the following are objectives for formal technical reviews?
Questions.option1: allow senior staff members to correct errors
Questions.option3: determining who introduced an error into a program
Questions.option4: uncover errors in software work products

Questions.question:
At the end of a formal technical review all attendees can decide to
A. accept the work product without modification
B. modify the work product and continue the review
C. reject the product due to stylistic discrepancies
D. reject the product due to severe errors
A review summary report answers which three questions?
Questions.option1: terminate project, replace producer, request a time extension
Questions.option2: what defects were found, what caused defects, who was responsible
Questions.option3: what was reviewed, who reviewed it, what were the findings

Questions.question: Which of these activities is not one of the activities recommended to be performed by an independent SQA group?
Questions.option1: prepare SQA plan for the project
Questions.option2: review software engineering activities to verify process compliance
Questions.option3: report any evidence of noncompliance to senior management
Questions.option4: serve as the sole test team for any software produced

Questions.question: Statistical quality assurance involves
Questions.option1: using sampling in place of exhaustive testing of software
Questions.option2: surveying customers to find out their opinions about product quality
Questions.option3: tracing each defect to its underlying cause, isolating the "vital few" causes, and moving to correct them
Questions.option4: tracing each defect to its underlying causes and using the Pareto principle to correct each problem found

A. errors in accuracy

Questions.option1: software developers do not need to do any testing

Questions.question: What is the normal order of activities in which traditional software testing is organized?
Questions.option1: integration testing, system testing, unit testing, validation testing
Questions.option2: unit testing, validation testing, system testing, integration testing
Questions.option3: unit testing, integration testing, validation testing, system testing
Questions.option4: validation testing, system testing, integration testing, unit testing

Questions.question: Which of the following strategic issues needs to be addressed in a successful software testing process?
Questions.option1: conduct formal technical reviews prior to testing
Questions.option2: specify requirements in a quantifiable manner

Questions.question: Testing helps us to __________  of product by finding defects in product.
Which of the following is not an objective of testing?
Questions.option3: Gaining confidence in and providing information about level of quality

Questions.question: Which technique is applied for usability testing?
Which testing is concerned with behaviour of whole product as per specified requirements?
What is the main purpose of integration testing?
Which of the following is the main advantage of Top Down Integration Testing?
Questions.option1: Major decision points are tested early.
Questions.option2: Modules are not tested by team again and again.
Questions.option3: No stubs need to be written

Questions.question: What is Pesticide Paradox?
Questions.option1: If the same tests are repeated over and over again , eventually the same set of test cases will no longer find any new bugs.
Questions.option2: A small number of modules contain most of the defects.
Questions.option3: Testing can show that defects are present , but can not prove that there are no defects.
Questions.option4: Finding and fixing defects does not help if the system built is unusable and does not fulfill the users need and expectations.
